subject: RE: [junit] Re: Help Please
msgSnippet: I had this error when I first used JUnit. It s caused by using the default no argument constructor (which as you can see is not made public in JUnit). You MUST
messageBody:
I had this error when I first used JUnit. It's caused by using the
default no argument constructor (which as you can see is not made public
in JUnit). You MUST define a one argument constructor. Here's the one I
use.

// One Argument Constructor
public <myobject>Test(String name) {
super(name);
}

This should help! :-)

Simon

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Simon P. Chappell simon.chappell@...
Web Developer / Programming Specialist www.landsend.com
Lands' End, Inc. (608) 935-4526

>
>Thanks,
>Andoni.
